Posts.Content: Kb2009 wrote: I have a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound scheduled for Tuesday. The doctor had found a lump that moves, is soft and she didn’t seem concerned. She asked if I’ve always had it. I wasn’t too sure. I called and requested an ultrasound. She decided to schedule a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound. Could this mean she’s expecting something worse? I’m only 26 and I’m very worried and scared Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound Kb2009 djmammo

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2018 06:40PM Kb2009 wrote: I went in for my ultrasound and mammogram today. They informed me that the radiologist didn’t see anything from looking it over quickly. But he will take a further look into it. I saw an image the tech took on the mammogram and didn’t feel comfortable with it. But if the radiologist said it was ok for now, I’ll just wait for the confirmation call giving me the all clear. Thank you all for the advice!
